areaSection: Guardamar del Segura is a charming coastal town nestled between Torrevieja and Alicante, offering the perfect balance between beach life and authentic Spanish character. Located in the Province of Alicante, this picturesque municipality sits along 10km of beautiful Mediterranean coastline, featuring several Blue Flag beaches including the popular Playa Centro and the quieter, dune-backed Las Ortigues. The area benefits from a microclimate that provides year-round sunshine—over 300 days annually—making it ideal for those seeking an escape from colder climates. Unlike the more commercialised coastal zones, Guardamar retains a distinctly Spanish atmosphere while welcoming an international community. The town's strategic location provides easy access to larger amenities in nearby Torrevieja and Alicante, yet maintains its peaceful, unhurried character.
lifestyleSection: Living in Guardamar del Segura means embracing a slower pace of life without sacrificing convenience. Your daily routine might include morning coffee at a beachfront chiringuito, a stroll through the Wednesday weekly market, or lunch with friends from the welcoming expat community. The town offers excellent healthcare facilities including Hospital de Torrevieja just 15 minutes away and local health centres with English-speaking staff. For dining, you'll find authentic Spanish restaurants serving fresh seafood alongside international cuisine catering to the established expatriate population. Shopping is straightforward with major supermarkets including Mercadona, Consum, and Lidl, plus the vibrant weekly market offering local produce. The relaxed Mediterranean lifestyle doesn't mean isolation—Guardamar has developed genuine community spaces where retirees connect, share experiences, and build lasting friendships. Golf enthusiasts will appreciate three championship courses within 20 minutes.

The Costa Blanca market has demonstrated consistent strength with 7% year-on-year appreciation. Rental potential is substantial: similar properties achieve approximately €700 per week in holiday rentals, generating potential annual returns of €36,400 for owners choosing the tourist rental route. Whether you're seeking a personal retreat or a property with income-generating potential, this apartment's combination of location, specification, and pricing positions it advantageously within the current market.

lifeAndAmenities.intro: Guardamar del Segura offers everything needed for comfortable daily living. The town provides seamless access to healthcare, quality shopping, and essential services—all within a peaceful, welcoming environment where you'll feel genuinely integrated into the community.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in Guardamar del Segura is comprehensive and readily accessible, providing peace of mind for retirees. The local Centro de Salud Guardamar offers general medical services with English-speaking staff, located just minutes from most residences. For more specialised care, Hospital de Torrevieja—a modern, well-equipped facility—is only 15 minutes away and serves the wider region. The area also has private clinics offering rapid access to specialists without long waiting lists. Spain's healthcare system is highly regarded, and the Costa Blanca region particularly caters to international residents with medical professionals experienced in treating expatriate communities. Emergency services are excellent, and many doctors hold UK qualifications.

shopping.text: Daily shopping is straightforward in Guardamar del Segura. Major supermarkets including Mercadona, Consum, and Lidl provide everything from groceries to household essentials, all within convenient distances. The Wednesday weekly market offers authentic Spanish experience with fresh local produce, regional specialities, and excellent value. For larger shopping requirements, Torrevieja's commercial centre—just 20 minutes away—offers extensive retailers and shopping malls. Most residents find weekly shopping entirely manageable on foot or a short drive.

transport.text: Getting around Guardamar del Segura is easy. While many residents prefer cars for independence, the town is compact and highly walkable for daily needs. Public transport connects to Torrevieja and Alicante via bus services, providing access to larger amenities and the airport. Alicante-Elche Airport—serving major European destinations—is approximately 45 minutes by car. The town's size means you won't spend life in traffic, yet you're never far from larger urban conveniences.

faqs.question: Hvor mye koster denne eiendommen?
faqs.answer: €241,000. This 3-bedroom apartment offers premium specification at an exceptional price point—50% less than comparable properties in nearby Jávea. Payment can be structured to suit your circumstances, and we assist with mortgage arrangements for qualified buyers.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca et godt sted å kjøpe eiendom?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca remains one of Europe's most attractive property markets. The region offers consistent capital appreciation (7% year-on-year), excellent climate, comprehensive healthcare, and well-established expatriate communities. Guardamar del Segura specifically provides authentic living away from overdeveloped tourist zones, making it ideal for retirees.

faqs.question: Kan utlendinger kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners have the same property ownership rights as Spanish citizens. You'll need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and can purchase properties outright or with Spanish mortgages. We guide you through all legal requirements and recommend consulting a Spanish property lawyer to ensure smooth completion.

faqs.question: Hva koster det å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect approximately 8-10% in additional costs: 3% transfer tax, 1.2% notary fees, 0.5% registration fees, and legal fees. For a €241,000 property, total costs would be approximately €20,000-€24,000. We provide detailed breakdowns before purchase.

faqs.question: Trenger jeg visum for å kjøpe eiendom i Spania?
faqs.answer: No, purchasing property doesn't automatically grant residency. However, significant property investment can support visa applications. Many retirees obtain D visas based on passive income or savings. Guardamar's healthcare, climate, and costs make it feasible to live here comfortably as a visitor, with many residents spending extended periods yearly.

faqs.question: Hvor mye er eiendomsskatten i Spania?
faqs.answer: Årlige eiendomsskatter (IBI) average 0.4-0.7% of cadastral value—typically lower than the official purchase price. For this property, expect approximately €500-€700 annually. Capital gains tax applies if you sell at profit; however, principal residences receive significant exemptions.

faqs.question: Er Costa Blanca bra for pensjonister?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Costa Blanca offers excellent healthcare, year-round sunshine, lower cost of living than northern Europe, and thriving expatriate communities. Guardamar del Segura specifically appeals to retirees seeking authentic Spanish culture with modern conveniences, peaceful surroundings, and active lifestyle opportunities including golf, beaches, and social activities.

faqs.question: What is the cost of living in Guardamar del Segura?
faqs.answer: Cost of living is significantly lower than northern Europe. Rent, groceries, utilities, and dining are 30-40% cheaper than UK equivalents. Many retirees live comfortably on €1,500-€2,000 monthly. Combined with potential rental income from the property, your living costs can be substantially offset.

faqs.question: Kan jeg få boliglån i Spania som utlending?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain Spanish mortgages, typically at 60-70% LTV with rates around 2.5-3.5%. Many international banks have Spanish branches serving expatriate communities. Lenders increasingly accept UK and other international pensions as income verification. We recommend speaking with mortgage specialists familiar with expatriate requirements.

faqs.question: Hvordan er været på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Exceptional. Guardamar del Segura enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually, with Mediterranean temperatures averaging 17°C in winter and 28°C in summer. Rainfall is minimal (200mm yearly), and the sea provides natural temperature regulation. This climate significantly benefits health and outdoor lifestyle pursuits.
